intro: Palicourea seemannii, commonly known as the purple-flowered palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, fragrant, purple flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. Palicourea seemannii is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
